alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Dickson; Montgomery; Robertson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:45AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dickson, southeastern Montgomery, northern Cheatham and southwestern Robertson Counties through 630 AM CST... At 544 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Ashland City to 7 miles north of Dickson. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Dickson, Ashland City, Coopertown, Pleasant View, Charlotte, Vanleer and Cheatham Dam. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 15 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for Middle Tennessee.
